1.descricao: When Abu Ja'far dies, destroy all creatures blocking or blocked by it. They can't be regenerated.

2.descricao: {1}{R}{R}, {T}: Gain control of target artifact for as long as you control Aladdin.

regras.texto: Aladdin's ability can take control of more than one artifact, although only one each time the ability is used.
You do not lose control of the permanent if it stops being an artifact. The validity of the target is checked only on announcement and resolution of the ability.
This ability may be used to tap more than one Wall per turn if you have enough mana, since tapping isn't part of the activation cost.
The ability may tap walls even when Ali Baba is tapped or just entered the battlefield, since the activation cost doesn't include {T}.

4.descricao: {2}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

5.descricao:
Argothian Pixies can't be blocked by artifact creatures.

Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Argothian Pixies by artifact creatures.

6.descricao: Sacrifice a creature: Add {2} to your mana pool.

7.descricao:
You may choose not to untap Ashnod's Battle Gear during your untap step.

{2}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/-2 for as long as Ashnod's Battle Gear remains tapped.

8.descricao: {T}, Sacrifice Ashnod's Transmogrant: Put a +1/+1 counter on target nonartifact creature. That creature becomes an artifact in addition to its other types.

regras.texto: It's the ability, not the counter that makes the creature an artifact. The creature remains an artifact even if the +1/+1 counter is removed.

9.descricao:
At the beginning of combat on your turn, Battering Ram gains banding until end of combat. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's blocking.)

Whenever Battering Ram becomes blocked by a Wall, destroy that Wall at end of combat.

regras.texto: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

11.descricao:
Remove Bronze Tablet from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.

Bronze Tablet enters the battlefield tapped.

{4}, {T}: Exile Bronze Tablet and target nontoken permanent an opponent owns. That player may pay 10 life. If he or she does, put Bronze Tablet into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player owns Bronze Tablet and you own the other exiled card.

regras.texto: If using a copy of the Tablet, you must trade the copy card to your opponent just like you would have traded the Tablet.
You can't choose to pay 10 life if you have less than 10 life, but you may choose to give up the game immediately. This has roughly the same effect.
You can take control of your opponent's Tablet and in the trade you only have to give them back their Tablet.
If the card being targeted by the Bronze Tablet is removed before Tablet takes effect, then the Tablet ability is countered and it remains tapped.

If the tablet is not still on the battlefield when the ability resolves, it is not exiled. The other player still has the choice to pay 10 life, and you still become the owner of their card if they choose not to do so.

12.descricao: {2}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

13.descricao:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.

{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

regras.texto: The first ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

If you tap City of Brass while you are casting a spell or activating an ability, its ability will trigger and wait. When you finish casting that spell or activating that ability, it's put on the stack, then City of Brass's triggered ability is put on the stack on top of it. That ability will resolve first.

On the other hand, you can tap City of Brass, put its triggered ability on the stack, and then respond to that ability by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the instant spell or activated ability will resolve first.

15.descricao:
Flying

Clockwork Avian enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.

At end of combat, if Clockwork Avian attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.

{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

regras.texto: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
If the ability to add counters resolves when there are already the maximum number of counters on it, any counters over the maximum are simply not added.

16.descricao:
Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

Colossus of Sardia doesn't untap during your untap step.

{9}: Untap Colossus of Sardia. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

regras.texto: The ability that untaps it during your upkeep has been returned to an activated ability. There is no restriction on how many times it can be untapped during your upkeep with this ability.

17.descricao: {3}, Discard a card at random: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

18.descricao: {T}: Cuombajj Witches deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to target creature or player of an opponent's choice.

regras.texto: In multiplayer games you can choose a different opposing player each time it is used. You also don't have to choose the same player that you targeted with the effect (or whose creature you targeted).
If either target becomes invalid, the other one is still affected.
Both targets are chosen on activation, but you choose your target before the opponent chooses.
The two targets can be the same.

19.descricao:
As Cursed Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.

The chosen player's maximum hand size is four.

regras.texto: The effect of lowering the maximum hand size makes it so the player discards down to 4 cards (instead of the usual 7) during the cleanup step.

You choose one opposing player just as this card is entering the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if this card changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if the chosen player leaves the game.

If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then a player puts Cursed Rack onto the battlefield choosing you, your maximum hand size will be four. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

20.descricao: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a wind counter on Cyclone, then sacrifice Cyclone unless you pay {G} for each wind counter on it. If you pay, Cyclone deals damage equal to the number of wind counters on it to each creature and each player.

21.descricao:
Dandân can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.

When you control no Islands, sacrifice Dandân.

22.descricao: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

regras.texto: If the artifact becomes an illegal target before resolution, then no damage is done.

23.descricao: At the beginning of your upkeep, target non-Wall creature an opponent controls gains forestwalk until your next upkeep.

regras.texto: In multiplayer games you can choose a different player's creature each upkeep. You are forced to pick a creature that some opponent controls if there is at least one creature on the battlefield that is a legal target.
If you have more than one Djinn, you can have all of them target the same creature with their ability.
If there are no creatures your opponent controls to target at the beginning of your upkeep, ignore this ability.

24.descricao: {T}, Exile Feldon's Cane: Shuffle your graveyard into your library.

25.descricao:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)

Enchanted creature has islandwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

26.descricao: At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player has more life than each other player, the player with the most life gains control of Ghazbán Ogre.

27.descricao: Giant Tortoise gets +0/+3 as long as it's untapped.

28.descricao: {T}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, draw a card. If you lose the flip, counter target artifact spell you control that isn't the target of an ability from another creature named Goblin Artisans.

29.descricao: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.

30.descricao: Whenever Hasran Ogress attacks, it deals 3 damage to you unless you pay {2}.

regras.texto: You either take damage or pay the 2 mana during resolution.

31.descricao: {T}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.

32.descricao: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.

33.descricao: {2}, {T}: Draw a card, then discard a card.

34.descricao:
Remove Jeweled Bird from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante.

{T}: Put Jeweled Bird into the ante. If you do, put all other cards you own from the ante into your graveyard, then draw a card.

regras.texto: The card is exchanged for your entire contribution to the ante. This means that it replaces all the cards if you have more than one already contributed.

35.descricao:
Flying

At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Junún Efreet unless you pay {B}{B}.

36.descricao:
As an additional cost to cast Metamorphosis, sacrifice a creature.

Add X mana of any one color to your mana pool, where X is one plus the sacrificed creature's converted mana cost. Spend this mana only to cast creature spells.

regras.texto: This mana may be used on additional costs to cast the spell, such as Kicker.
You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

37.descricao:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land.

{T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

regras.texto: When it is an Assembly-Worker, it is an artifact and can therefore be affected by spells and abilities that affect artifacts.
When it is an Assembly-Worker, it is still a land and retains all of its other abilities.
Any counters on the Assembly-Worker remain even if the counters stop being meaningful when it de-animates.

If an Assembly-Worker is changed to another land type, it will stay a 2/2 artifact creature and keep the creature type "Assembly-Worker" (until end of turn), but it will change its land type as directed.
Tapping a land for something other than mana is not a mana ability.
When animated into an Assembly-Worker, it has creature type Assembly-Worker.
The card name does not change. It remains "Mishra's Factory".

If another player takes control of the Factory while it is animated, that player keeps control until the control effect ends. They do not lose control just because the card stops being an Assembly-Worker. Note that Auras which steal cards will go to the graveyard if the permanent they enchant is no longer valid.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

38.descricao: Whenever Nafs Asp deals damage to a player, that player loses 1 life at the beginning of his or her next draw step unless he or she pays {1} before that draw step.

regras.texto: If its damage gets redirected to its controller, it will still trigger the ability.
The player can pay the {1} mana at any time after damage is done before the draw step of that player's turn. People commonly pay during upkeep.
If it damages a player twice, they get to pay or take damage twice during their next draw step.
The ability does not cause itself to trigger again. It cause loss of life, and not damage.

39.descricao: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

40.descricao: {6}, {T}: Return target permanent you both own and control to your hand.

41.descricao: {2}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn. Return Rakalite to its owner's hand at the beginning of the next end step.

regras.texto: Only returns to your hand if it is still on the battlefield at the end of the turn. If it leaves the battlefield, it does not return.
Can be used any number of times during the turn before it leaves the battlefield.
Can choose a different creature or player for each use.

43.descricao: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

44.descricao:
As Shapeshifter enters the battlefield, choose a number between 0 and 7.

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may choose a number between 0 and 7.

Shapeshifter's power is equal to the last chosen number and its toughness is equal to 7 minus that number.

regras.texto: The ability that sets its power and toughness is a characteristic-defining ability. This means it applies before any other effects that modify power and/or toughness.
The ability that lets you choose a new number is a triggered ability that triggers only once each upkeep.

45.descricao: {T}: Draw a card and reveal it. If it isn't a land card, discard it.

regras.texto: If the draw is replaced by another effect, none of the rest of Sindbad's ability applies, even if the draw is replaced by another draw (such as with Enduring Renewal).
To avoid confusion, reveal the card you draw before putting it with the rest of the cards in your hand.

46.descricao:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{T}, Sacrifice Strip Mine: Destroy target land.

47.descricao: {2}, {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

48.descricao:
You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Weaponry during your untap step.

{2}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 for as long as Tawnos's Weaponry remains tapped.

49.descricao:
Flying

Tetravus enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove any number of +1/+1 counters from Tetravus. If you do, put that many 1/1 colorless Tetravite artifact creature tokens onto the battlefield. They each have flying and "This creature can't be enchanted."

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile any number of tokens put onto the battlefield with Tetravus. If you do, put that many +1/+1 counters on Tetravus.

regras.texto: If the Tetravus is destroyed when the Tetravites are off the card, they are not destroyed, they are just orphaned.
Any +1/+1 counter which is on this card can be turned into a Tetravite token. It does not care where the +1/+1 counter came from.
Only Tetravites from this specific Tetravus may be used for the ability. Ones from a different Tetravus can't.
This card now has two upkeep-triggered abilities. Its controller chooses the order they are put on the stack, and thus the order in which they resolve each upkeep.

50.descricao:
Triskelion enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.

Remove a +1/+1 counter from Triskelion: Triskelion deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

regras.texto: If you activate the ability of an attacking or blocking Triskelion during the declare blockers step, it will deal less combat damage as a result. If you wait until the combat damage step, but Triskelion is dealt lethal damage, it'll be destroyed before you get a chance to activate its ability.

If Triskelion has damage marked on it, activating its ability may cause that damage to become lethal. For example, say a Triskelion with two +1/+1 counters on it has been dealt 2 damage earlier in the turn. If you activate its ability by removing a +1/+1 counter from it, it now has 2 toughness and is destroyed as a state-based action. You won't be able to remove the other +1/+1 counter from it to activate its ability again. The first activation of the ability will still resolve.

51.descricao: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

regras.texto: This is not a toggle effect. If you use Twiddle to tap a card and before it takes effect your opponent taps it, Twiddle will not automatically untap the card.
The decision whether or not to tap or untap is made on resolution. This is not a modal spell.

52.descricao: {0}: Urza's Avenger gets -1/-1 and gains your choice of banding, flying, first strike, or trample until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

regras.texto: The -1/-1 is not permanent. It lasts until the end of the turn as do the abilities that are granted.

53.descricao: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.

regras.texto: If you have at least one of each of the three Urza's lands on the battlefield, you must take the 2 mana instead of just one.

54.descricao: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.

regras.texto: If you have at least one of each of the three Urza's lands on the battlefield, you must take the 2 mana instead of just one.

55.descricao: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.

regras.texto: If you have at least one of each of the three Urza's lands on the battlefield, you must take the 2 mana instead of just one.

56.descricao: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Power-Plant and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.

regras.texto: If you have at least one of each of the three Urza's lands on the battlefield, you must take the 2 mana instead of just one.

57.descricao: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.

regras.texto: If you have at least one of each of the three Urza's lands on the battlefield, you must take the 2 mana instead of just one.

58.descricao: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.

regras.texto: If you have at least one of each of the three Urza's lands on the battlefield, you must take the 2 mana instead of just one.

59.descricao: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.

regras.texto: If you have at least one of each of the three Urza's lands on the battlefield, you must take the 2 mana instead of just one.

60.descricao: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.

regras.texto: If you have at least one of each of the three Urza's lands on the battlefield, you must take the 2 mana instead of just one.

61.descricao: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {3} to your mana pool instead.

62.descricao: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {3} to your mana pool instead.

63.descricao: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {3} to your mana pool instead.

64.descricao: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Power-Plant, add {3} to your mana pool instead.

65.descricao:
Attacco improvviso

È considerato un muro.
65.texto: Anche i generali più ligi alla tradizione madoficarono le loro tattiche dopo la battaglia di Sarinth, nella quale un manipolo di contadini armati di lance tenne a bada tre Wurm Devastatori inferociti.

66.descricao: Trample; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

regras.texto: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

67.descricao: {T}: Until your next upkeep, target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

regras.texto: Wears off at the beginning of the upkeep, not during upkeep.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

68.descricao:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you don't, tap Yawgmoth Demon and it deals 2 damage to you.

regras.texto: The sacrificing of an artifact is not mandatory. You can choose not to sacrifice an artifact but will pay the consequences.
